conclusion: Consider the forces acting on each object and the laws of physics.
Objects A and B are moving through the air and will experience air resistance.
Objects C, D, E, and F are stationary and will not experience air resistance.
Apply Newton's Third Law: Objects C, D, E, and F will experience an equal and opposite force from objects A and B.
Objects C, D, E, and F are stationary and will not experience any force from objects A and B.
Apply Newton's Second Law: Net force on objects C, D, E, and F is zero because they are stationary.
Objects A and B are moving through the air and will experience air resistance.
Air resistance will cause objects A and B to slow down and eventually stop.
Apply Newton's Third Law again: Objects C, D, E, and F will experience an equal and opposite force from objects A and B.
Objects C, D, E, and F are stationary and will not experience any force from objects A and B.
Apply Newton's Second Law: Net force on objects C, D, E, and F is zero because they are stationary.

Conclusion: Objects A and B will come into contact with objects C, D, E, and F due to gravity. Objects C, D, E, and F will experience an equal and opposite force from objects A and B, causing them to accelerate in the opposite direction. Objects A and B will slow down and eventually stop due to air resistance. Objects C, D, E, and F will remain stationary.
